subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Medium---well!
author: shipsdrummer@aol.com
full_text:
--part1_13808.296c31fa.388f3568_boundary
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

 
Just adding: thats exactly how it works. When we contact a spirit or see 
one they wont talk "unless" a question is asked. Then they will speak or send 
a picture or noise or whatever.
Talking to spirits is a series of questions. One you notice that you have 
the ability, then people just look at it awhile, then it hits them to ask 
questions and then they find that the spirits answer things too. :) The box is 
a tool to bring the conversations on the outside of your head. Its a big 
deal. How did this first get thought of, Frank? How did Frank get the idea to 
ask it questions? That is what mediumship is all about.
 
My son has built one of the boxes. I am trying to get him on here because 
he will do the work for me of building them. I help a little from having 6 
months of electronics too. This is really going to go far. This is a brave new 
adventure and I am happy to be here. 
Thank you
San
 
 
Tom_Ray@... writes:

Well, I consider myself a "Psychic" too I use a "monitor Technique not 
unlike the CIA was said to employ (I discovered it on my own and later read that 
the CIA was using a similar method) I use a "monitor" or person to ask 
questions and I find I can reply psychically It involves not using the 
"questioning/Well, I consider myself a "Psychic" too I use a "monitor Technique not 
unlike the CIA was said to employ (I discovered it on my own and later read 
that the CIA was using a similar method) I use a "monitor" or person to ask 
questions and I find I can reply psychically It involves not using the 
"questioning/<WBR>judgemental" part of my brain and staying in the "declaritive 
mode"--somehow THAT holds the psychic "conduit" open and I can function as a 
medium. The monitor person asks the questions and the replies come. Should I 
ask the question myself, however, the conduit shuts. It IS interesting 

My suggestions on how the boxes work are based on my own years of 
experience with random viewing fields. once it became obvious how THEY worked, it was 
a simple thing to see the correspondence with audio factor in boxes. One 
thing the boxes have taught me, however, is that it is NOT "all in the head" 
as these sound files can be shared with others.---This is making me rethink 
that my VIDEO random feild stuff may also not be "in the head, and perhaps 
may be captured on imagery. 

--- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) , Frank 
Sumption <purplealiengirl@pur> wrote:
>
> You're making alot of presumptuous statements that have no basis in fact.
> You're just jealous cuz you can't hear the boxes. I don't need any noise 
to
> hear spirits, and I do just fine seeing through the third eye. It's just
> that same old skeptic BS that it's all in the brain.
> 
> F-S
> 
> On Sat, Jan 23, 2010 at 6:54 PM, Tom <Tom_Ray@...> wrote:
> 
> >
> >
> > The random sounds make it easier to hear spirit voices in your head. I
> > discovered this effect VISUALLY staining at rsndom dots on a viewing 
screen.
> > In the visual mode the spirit only has to suppress the light spots and
> > enhance the dark spots that do not match the image it is 
sending----Light
> > and dark spots on the screen that correspond to the image dont have to 
be
> > modulated at all---the result is a SAVING of "psychic energy" on the
> > observers part, perhaps not much, but enough to make the difference 
between
> > seeing and NOT seeing, however. Random sound would work the same way 
only
> > the frequencies that did not match the sounds being sent would have to 
be
> > blocked or replaced, the frequencies already present would NOT have to 
be
> > modulated--so SOME energy is saved and not as much effort is needed to 
hear
> > the entity. Effectively enhancing one's innate abilities. It a lot 
easier to
> > hear a spirit sound if some of the waves are already in place, than it 
would
> > be if you had to build the entire word from scratch.
> >
> >
> > --- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com)  
<EVP-ITC%40yahoogroEVP-ITC>, "Jill"
> > <jjkamp@> wrote:
> > >
> > > That doesn't surprise me at all. I wish someone could figure out why
> > using the box enhances one's abilities as a medium, but apparently this 
is
> > so -- I know it was true for me. As much experience as you have, Frank, 
it
> > would seem to follow you'd have built up some considerable ability.
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > > --- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com)  
<EVP-ITC%40yahoogroEVP-ITC>, Frank
> > Sumption <purplealiengirl@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > Went to the medium development class last night and OMG! Suprised
> > myselff,
> > > > had no idea I could get visions on demand like that. I am uncertain 
if
> > it
> > > > was due to being in a group with those expectations though. I've 
never
> > > > attempted to read for anyone before, always seems kinda 
presumptuous to
> > me.
> > > > They do a circle for exchanging messages the third Friday of the 
month.
> > > >
> > > > Frank-S
> > > >
> > >
> >
> > 
> >
>


--part1_13808.296c31fa.388f3568_boundary
